questions.context: Harry had two options for his day off: going to the park or going to the beach. If he decided to go to the park, it meant that he would have a lovely picnic with his family. On the other hand, if he chose the beach, he would be able to enjoy a refreshing swim in the ocean. The only thing that was certain was that either Harry would go to the park or he would go to the beach. It was unclear which option he would ultimately choose, as it could be that he would go to the park alone, go to the beach alone, or even do both activities.
questions.question: Can we say at least one of the following must always be true? (a) he will have a picnic with his family and (b) he won't swim in the ocean

questions.context: If he doesn't put in the effort to study for the upcoming test, he is bound to fail. He knows that the only way to succeed is by dedicating time and energy towards studying.
questions.question: Based on context, can we say, at least one of the following must always be true? (a) he is not studying for the test and (b) he will fail the test

questions.context: All creatures with fur possess thick skin, including this particular lion that is covered in fur.
questions.question: Does this mean that lion does not have thick skin?
